text: Sudhira Das (; 8 March 1932 – 30 October 2015) was an Indian engineer. She was the first female engineer from the state of Odisha. She became an engineer at a time when education was a taboo for women in India. == Early life == She was born in an aristocratic family in Cuttack, Odisha on 8 March 1932. She had a passion for Mathematics from her childhood. === Education === She graduated with Bachelor of Science from the Ravenshaw College in 1951, after which she joined University of Science and Technology, Calcutta in 1956 for her masters in Radio Physics and Electronics. == Work == After graduating with her MSc. (Tech), Das started teaching at the Berhampur Engineering School (currently Uma Charan Pattnaik Engineering School) as a lecturer in the department of Mathematics in 1957. Later she became the principal of Women’s Polytechnic, Rourkela. During 1957-1990, she served the Government of Odisha in various different capacities. During that period she founded Women’s Polytechnic, Bhubaneswar, an institutions providing diploma programs to female students which has been one of her major contributions. == Death == She died on 30 October 2015 at the age of 83. == References == Category:Indian women engineers Category:1932 births Category:2015 deaths Category:People from Cuttack Category:Ravenshaw University alumni Category:University of Calcutta alumni Category:20th-century Indian engineers Category:20th-century Indian women scientists Category:20th-century Indian scientists Category:Women scientists from Odisha Category:Engineers from Odisha Category:21st-century Indian women scientists Category:21st-century Indian engineers Category:20th- century women engineers Category:21st-century women engineers
